default: (a) a {@filter martial weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon} and a {@item shield|phb} or (b) two {@filter martial weapons|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon}
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|PHB} or (b) a {@item dungeoneer's pack}

fluff.name: The Juggernaut
entries: Un guerriero solitario si trova in piedi in mezzo a una sfilza di cadaveri. Volge lo sguardo verso l'orizzonte, scorgendo un'altra banda di nemici furiosi. Solleva il suo maul e adotta una posizione selvaggia, preparandosi a fronteggiare la seconda tempesta.

Una fanciulla vestita di armatura è circondata dai nemici, mentre i suoi alleati sono sparsi sul campo di battaglia. Con un ghigno sul volto, sbatte il suo scudo contro la terra. Con un'ondata di forza i nemici vengono fatti volare e intorno a lei prendono posto i suoi alleati feriti, ma ora al sicuro.

Un grosso orco vestito con un'armatura di piastre se ne sta ingobbito su un tavolo che rappresenta un finto campo di battaglia. Il guerriero, prendendo la sua spada, esce dalla tenda, pronto a mettere alla prova le sue lunghe ore di pianificazione.

entries.name: The Insurmountable
entries: I juggernaut, maestri del controllo del campo di battaglia, sono guerrieri il cui amore per la battaglia li spinge a ottenere un maggiore controllo su di essa. Utilizzando la magia innata presente in tutti gli esseri, i juggernaut incanalano questa energia nella loro arma, spesso prestando giuramento per legare lo scudo a loro in un cosiddetto legame di ferro.

Sfruttando il peso della loro arma, i juggernaut scagliano i nemici sul campo di battaglia, distogliendo l'attenzione dai loro compagni e tenendoli al sicuro. Per questi carri armati, l'arma rappresenta l'onore, il giuramento e lo spirito. Senza di essa non sono altro che un guerriero mediocre.

entries.name: Creating a Juggernaut
entries: Il potere principale di un juggernaut è la sua arma e il legame che la rafforza. Come sei diventato un juggernaut? Chi ti ha insegnato i tuoi metodi? Qual è la storia della tua arma attuale? È speciale per te o l'hai semplicemente trovata? La funzione principale di un juggernaut è quella di far sì che i nemici rivolgano la loro animosità verso di voi invece che verso coloro che volete proteggere.

La maggior parte dei juggernaut tende ad essere di natura buona a causa della natura della loro carica, ma a seconda dell'ambiente in cui si trovano o di chi li ha influenzati, alcuni possono diventare guardie del corpo o esecutori di esseri potenti come diavoli o tiranni.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: È possibile creare rapidamente un juggernaut seguendo i seguenti suggerimenti. Innanzitutto, la Forza dovrebbe essere il punteggio di abilità più alto, seguito dalla Costituzione. In secondo luogo, scegliete il background {@background Folk Hero}. Terzo, scegliere {@item Chain Mail|PHB}, un {@item Longsword|PHB} e un {@item shield|PHB}, e un {@item Explorer's Pack|PHB}.

classFeature.name: Iron Bond
entries: Al 1° livello, si ottiene la capacità di formare un potente legame con la propria arma. Si può creare un legame con un'arma nell'arco di un'ora, che può essere effettuata durante un breve riposo. È necessario impugnare l'arma per tutta la durata, al termine della quale si ottengono i seguenti benefici mentre si impugna l'arma legata.

items: L'arma legata è indistruttibile con mezzi non magici, non pesa nulla per voi e pesa 3 volte il peso normale per le altre creature.
Si conosce la direzione generale dell'arma legata, a condizione che si trovi sullo stesso piano di esistenza, e si può individuare la sua posizione esatta se ci si trova entro 9 metri da essa.

entries.name: Bonding with a Shield
entries: È anche possibile formare un Legame di Ferro con uno scudo, e farlo gli conferisce le proprietà aggiuntive:

items: Lo scudo legato conta come un'arma da mischia semplice che infligge {@dice 1d6} danni da percosse.
È possibile indossare e togliere lo scudo utilizzando un'azione Interagire con un oggetto.

classFeature.name: Battlecry
entries: Quando lo sbloccherete al 1° livello, come azione bonus potrete provocare le persone a combattere contro di voi o a radunare gli spiriti dei vostri amici.

Dopo aver usato il proprio stregone il numero di volte indicato per il proprio livello di juggernaut nella colonna stregone della tabella dei juggernaut, è necessario terminare un riposo breve o lungo prima di poter usare nuovamente il proprio stregone.
La DC del tiro salvezza del juggernaut è 8 + il bonus di competenza + il modificatore di Costituzione.

entries.name: Taunt
entries: Scegliete una creatura entro 9 metri da voi che possa vedervi o sentirvi. La creatura colpita deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Saggezza contro la vostra DC di tiro del Juggernaut o ha svantaggio su qualsiasi attacco che compie contro chiunque tranne voi fino alla fine del suo prossimo turno. I bersagli sono immuni a questo effetto se non possono vedervi o sentirvi o se non possono essere {@condition frightened}.

entries.name: Rally
entries: Le creature a vostra scelta entro 9 metri da voi guadagnano punti ferita temporanei pari al vostro livello di juggernaut.

classFeature.name: Juggernaut Specialty
entries: Al 2° livello, si ottiene una Specialità da Juggernaut. Scegliete una delle seguenti:

entries.name: Heavy Handed
entries: I suoi attacchi sono brutali e inaspettatamente duri.
Quando si mette a segno un colpo critico con un attacco con arma da mischia, la creatura ha svantaggio al successivo tiro per colpire.

entries.name: Reckless Defense
entries: Se vedete arrivare un colpo grosso, sapete come respingerlo con tutte le vostre forze. La tensione che ne deriva vi lascia però aperti a un contrattacco.

Quando una creatura vi colpisce con un attacco, potete usare la vostra reazione per costringere la creatura a ripetere il tiro per colpire, e deve usare il nuovo tiro. In questo caso, la prossima volta che una creatura effettua un attacco contro di voi prima dell'inizio del vostro prossimo turno, avrà vantaggio sul tiro per colpire.

entries.name: Unyielding Strength
entries: Siete abbastanza forti da potervi fidare delle persone fino a dove potete lanciarle.

{@action Shove} gli attacchi che si compiono nel proprio turno spingono le creature di 3 metri. Inoltre, se una creatura di una categoria di taglia più grande o più piccola effettua un attacco in mischia contro di voi, potete usare la vostra reazione per effettuare un attacco di spingere contro di essa.

classFeature.name: Superior Health
entries: Quando si ottiene questa caratteristica al 2° livello, il massimo dei punti ferita aumenta di 2 punti e aumenta di 1 ogni volta che si guadagna un livello da Juggernaut. Al 13° livello, il massimo dei punti ferita aumenta di altri 13 punti e aumenta di 2 ogni volta che si guadagna un livello da Juggernaut.

classFeature.name: Juggernaut Ideal
entries: Al 3° livello si deve scegliere un ideale a cui tendere, descritto di seguito. Si ottiene una caratteristica ideale da questo sentiero al 3° livello, al 7° livello, all'11° livello e al 15° livello.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: Quando si raggiunge il 4° livello, si può aumentare un punteggio di abilità a scelta di 2 o due punteggi di abilità a scelta di 1. Come al solito, non si può aumentare un punteggio di abilità superiore a 20 usando questa caratteristica.
Se il DM permette l'uso di prodezze, si può invece prendere un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Mighty Physique
entries: Al 5° livello, si impara a utilizzare la propria forza possente per l'attacco e il controllo. Sei considerato abile in {@skill Athletics} e usi il doppio del tuo bonus di competenza per le prove di {@skill Athletics}. Se sei già esperto in {@skill Athletics}, scegli un'altra competenza dall'elenco delle classi.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: At 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Improved Iron Bond
entries: Starting at 6th level you gain the following benefits:
If your bonded weapon is within 30 feet of you, you can use your bonus action to summon it to your hand.

As a bonus action, you can shunt your bonded weapon into a pocket dimension and re-summon it using a bonus action. You can only send your bonded weapon to the pocket dimension if you are holding it, and the weapon can stay in this pocket dimension forever with no ill effects on it.
Additionally, your bonded weapon counts as magical for the  purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to non-magical attacks and damage.

classFeature.name: Stockade
entries: Starting at 6th level, in combat, the area within 5 feet of you is considered difficult terrain for creatures you choose. In addition, whenever you make an opportunity attack, you can attempt to {@action grapple} or {@action shove} the creature instead of making a melee attack.

classFeature.name: Ideal feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Juggernaut Ideal.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Se il DM permette l'uso di prodezze, si può invece prendere un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Indefatigable
entries: Starting at 9th level, you gain a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus to all saving throws to avoid {@condition exhaustion}, stage 5 of {@condition exhaustion} for you now reduces your speed to 5, and you now have 7 stages of {@condition exhaustion}, instead of 6. Stage 6 is now {@condition unconscious|PHB|unconsciousness}, and 7 is death.

classFeature.name: Improved Grapple
entries: At 10th level, when grappling a creature, you can drag them with you with no penalty to your movement.

classFeature.name: Ideal feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Juggernaut Ideal.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Se il DM permette l'uso di prodezze, si può invece prendere un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Shove
entries: Starting at 13th level, whenever you successfully shove a creature, you can push it away from you as well as knock it {@condition prone}.

classFeature.name: Improved Superior Health
entries: At 13th level, your hit point maximum increases by an additional 13 points, and it now increases by 2 every time you gain a Juggernaut level.

classFeature.name: Jötungrip
entries: At 14th level, you can wield two handed melee weapons in one hand, but you can only add half your proficiency bonus to attacks with them. Additionally, if you are wielding a weapon with the versatile property in one hand, you can use the two-handed die instead. If you are Small, you can now wield weapons with the heavy property in two hands with no penalty.

classFeature.name: Ideal feature
entries: At 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Juggernaut Ideal.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Se il DM permette l'uso di prodezze, si può invece prendere un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Improved Juggernaut Specialty
entries: At 17th level, the specialty you chose at the beginning of your adventure has grown more powerful.

entries.name: Heavy Handed
entries: On a critical hit, use the maximum die results on your damage dice.

entries.name: Reckless Defense
entries: When you use your reaction to force the attacker to reroll their attack, they do so with disadvantage. If the attack still hits you, you can make a melee weapon attack against the attacker as part of the same reaction.

entries.name: Unyielding Strength
entries: Creatures that you grapple are considered {@condition restrained}.

classFeature.name: Steeled Nerves
entries: At 18th level, you've sustained so many wounds, you're almost numb to the big hits. Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Se il DM permette l'uso di prodezze, si può invece prendere un {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Unstoppable Force
entries: At 20th level, as an action you can become the ultimate paragon of force, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:

items: You have resistance to all damage.
You are immune to being {@condition grappled}, {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition petrified}, {@condition restrained}, and {@condition stunned}, and you can't be knocked {@condition prone}.
You can't be forcefully moved, your speed can't be reduced by any means, and you can walk through any creature's space.
Attacks with a bonded weapon deal double damage to objects and structures.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Defender
entries: Defenders are juggernauts that seek to protect and heal those around them. Whether they are on the front lines holding back the enemy, or sticking in the back keeping a wizard or archer safe, they are welcome additions to any team for taking and dealing damage.

Defenders are the juggernauts who aim to protect the weak and innocent from further harm. Their fighting style involves mainly protecting, taunting, and blocking enemies from harming others, even being able to make an aura of safety around them and their allies when they really need it most. Defenders are kind people that always give their best in combat.

subclassFeature.name: Health Sacrifice
entries: Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you can sacrifice a small portion of yourself to heal your allies or demolish your foes. You can spend an amount of Hit Dice per round equal to half your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Heal
entries: As an action, you can touch one creature and heal them by expending some of your hit dice. Roll the dice and add your Constitution modifier to each, restoring a number of hit points equal to the total.

entries.name: Harm
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend some of your hit dice to infuse your attack with a burst of radiant energy. Roll the dice and add your Constitution modifier to each, dealing extra radiant damage equal to the total, in addition to the weapon's damage.

subclassFeature.name: Shelter
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can make {@skill Medicine} checks as a bonus action on your turn, and you gain proficiency in {@skill Medicine}. If you are already proficient in this skill, you can choose to be proficient in one of the following skills: {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Insight}, {@skill Perception} or {@skill Survival}.
Additionally, you have advantage on checks to diagnose diseases and other medical conditions or to identify a creature's wounds or cause of death.

subclassFeature.name: Bastion
entries: Starting at 11th level, while holding your bonded shield, you can use your action to create an impenetrable dome of force in a 15-foot radius around you, and lasts until the end of your next turn.

When you create the dome, choose any number of willing creatures you can see within 120 feet of you. Each creature teleports to an unoccupied space of its choice inside the dome and can move through the dome freely, including yourself.

A hostile creature that is in the dome's area when you create it is pushed to the nearest unoccupied space and must make a Constitution saving throw against your juggernaut save DC or take {@dice 2d8} force damage.

The dome prevents hostile creatures from passing or reaching through it and it prevents their spells and attacks made with ranged or reach weapons from entering it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hospice
entries: Starting at 15th level, you gain the power to bring someone back if they've died recently. You can cast {@spell revivify} once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ravager
entries: The phrase: "Your best defense is offense" embodies this class. Ravagers are juggernauts who seek the path to defense in violence. Their goal is to end fights as quickly as possible, dealing consistent damage whether attacking or positioning their enemies.

Ravagers are juggernauts who seek the path to defending those they care about through violence. They stay right up in the thick of it and keep the focus on them. Ravagers are aggressive, brutal and versatile, and they are proud of their abilities, always trying to prove themselves in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Ruthless
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your {@action Shove} attacks deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier.
Additionally, when you successfully start a grapple and at the start of each of your turns, any creature you have {@condition grappled} takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Determined
entries: Starting at 7th level, little can stand in the way between you and your goals. You ignore nonmagical difficult terrain, and you gain climbing and swimming speeds equal to your walking speed. Additionally, you can move through a hostile creature's space, though you can't end your movement in an occupied space.

subclassFeature.name: Oh No You Don't
entries: Starting at 11th level, when a hostile creature successfully ends your grapple, you can use your reaction to make a {@action Grapple} attack against any creature within 5 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Relentless
entries: At 15th level, even as your strength begins to fade, you keep fighting. Having 0 hit points doesn't knock you {@condition unconscious}, but you must still make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Giantslayer
entries: Giantslayers focus all of their strength and skill with weapons into single powerful strikes meant to cripple the largest of foes. With their size and bulk they can effectively grapple, pin, and submit far larger opponents. They prize themselves on their unique tactics to fight these monsters and their resistance to their attacks, while striking back with equal ferocity.

Giantslayers have no problem standing up to larger opponents. Mainly because when they do, they can look them in the eye by growing to an inhuman size, dealing singular, heavy blows. In battle, they are usually right up in the front wrestling with the giant for his weapon. Giantslayers are a hearty bunch that always love a good rumble.

subclassFeature.name: Enlarge
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you have the ability to grow to an immense size to fight your enemies. You can use a bonus action to gain the following benefits for one minute:

items: Your size doubles in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by eight.
Your size increases by one category. If you were Small, now you are Medium. If you were Medium, now you are Large.
You have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.
Your weapons also grow to match your new size. While these weapons are enlarged, you deal {@dice 1d4} extra damage when you make melee weapon attacks with them.

entries: Everything you are wearing and carrying changes size with you. Any item dropped returns to normal size at once. If there isn't enough room for you to double in size, you attain the maximum possible size in the space available.
This effect can not be {@spell counterspell|phb|counterspelled} or {@spell dispel magic|phb|dispelled}.
You can use this feature twice per long rest. At 11th level you regain all your expended uses of this feature when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mountainous Frame
entries: Starting at 7th level, you've enlarged yourself so much, that some of the growth has stuck around even after you shrink to normal size. When you gain this feature, roll {@dice 3d4}. You grow a number of inches in height equal to the roll.
In addition, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

subclassFeature.name: Titanic Strike
entries: Starting at 11th level, you merrily crush your opponents to dust. When you make a melee weapon attack, you can choose to make the attack with disadvantage. If you hit, the attack is a critical hit. You can't use this feature if you already have disadvantage on the attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Titan-Sized
entries: At 15th level, you can use a bonus action to consume two uses of Enlarge, instead of one, to grow even larger. You can also use a bonus action consume an extra use of Enlarge if you are already Enlarged. While you are Titan-sized, you gain the following benefits in place of the Enlarge feature's benefits:

items: Your normal size quadruples in all dimensions, and your weight is multiplied by sixty four.
Your size increases by two categories of your original. If you were Small, now you are Large. If you were Medium, now you are Huge.
Your weapons also grow to match your new size. While these weapons are titan-sized, you deal {@dice 2d4} extra damage when you make melee weapon attacks with them.

subclassFeature.name: Dreadnought
entries: Some juggernauts are beaten and battered for their entire life, but this gives them an ideology of survival, that outlasting an enemy in combat is a guaranteed path to victory. The dreadnought does just that, shrugging off mighty blows endlessly until their opponent eventually tires and is dealt the killing blow.
Consummate professionals among juggernauts, dreadnoughts never seem to let up. Even in the biggest and bloodiest battles, they and their squad are always the last ones standing.

If one hasn't fought a Dreadnought before, it can be very jarring. Their large shield always seems to interpose itself between you and them. No matter how many times you strike, their stamina never seems to wane. Most Dreadnoughts are usually level-headed and stoic.

subclassFeature.name: Defensive Formation
entries: Starting at 3rd level, all allies within 5 feet of you gain half cover, and when a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. If the attack hits, you can deal bludgeoning damage equal to your Strength modifier to the attacker.

subclassFeature.name: Bolstering Ranks
entries: At 7th level, when you take the Help action to assist with a Charisma check, the creature you helped gains a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 10 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5)
Additionally, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Performance}.

subclassFeature.name: Grit
entries: At 11th level, all damage except for psychic damage that you take is reduced by an amount equal to your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Resolute
entries: At 15th level, at the start of each of your turns, if you have no more than 3 times your character level in hit points remaining, you regain hit points equal to your Constitution modifier + half your Juggernaut level. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Sanguinaire
entries: Sanguinaires tend to be unlucky adventurers who were bitten by a vampire to gain life-draining power. These juggernauts are usually thralls for more powerful vampire lords, but some though, through research, planning, or good (or bad) luck, stumbled upon similar powers.
No matter how they came across the power, they are fierce, intimidating, and despite all the injuries they face, they seem to sow themselves back together in front of your very eyes.

Sanguinaires are quite intimidating combatants. They throw opponents around the battlefield, gashing deep and sucking the very life out of them, seemingly closing all of their wounds sustained from the fighting. The stare of one can make a grizzled veteran become their biggest fan,trying their absolute best to help the Sanguinaire. Sanguinaires are usually arrogant and gluttonous.

subclassFeature.name: Draining Strikes
entries: Starting at 3rd level, your attacks gain a life draining aura. Once per turn when you hit a living creature with a melee weapon attack, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Constitution modifier, and the creature's hit point maximum is reduced by the same amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.
Additionally, at level 15, you can use Draining Strikes twice per turn, and the temporary hit points gained from this feature stack.

subclassFeature.name: Bloodsense
entries: At 7th level, you have advantage on any checks to see through an illusory disguise within 10 feet of you, and on all checks to find the location of living humanoids that involve scent or blood.
Additionally, if there is a living humanoid within 10 feet of you, you know their location.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Charm
entries: Starting at 11th level, as an action you can target one humanoid you can see within 30 feet of you. If the target can see you, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by you. The {@condition charmed} target regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

If you or your companions harm the {@condition charmed} target, the effect ends. Otherwise, the effect lasts 1 minute or until you are {@condition unconscious}, are on a different plane of existence than the target, or take a bonus action to end the effect.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Escape
entries: At 15th level, if you drop to 0 hit points, you instead drop to 1 hit point and immediately are under the effects of the spell {@spell gaseous form} for 1 minute.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
